intro: Cyrtandra perstaminodica, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Cyrtandra perstaminodica plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems, supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
